data.text: @mosermusic Chicago is down from an almost 30% postive test rate in them middle of January to 3% now. Get over it and quit punishing kids to further your agenda.
@OtherStories123 @mosermusic An argument for providing better quality masks!
@mosermusic Most teachers and student I know only wear cloth masks, which makes it 27 minutes. If they stop wearing them it goes down to 20 and 15 respectively. Not much of a change if you ask me.
@mosermusic Thanks for sharing this; apparently @ChiPubSchools has sudden amnesia - hopefully this sparks some people to pause on unmasking...
@STGhee @ChiPubSchools so as usual they *do* know better, they're intentionally choosing harm
@mosermusic This chart is used by @ChiPubSchools in their Covid training.
@mosermusic @Cato_of_Utica Even if your kid is wearing a N95 and the other kid is wearing a surgical mask! Still shorter than a school day!

If there isn't a lot of testing happening, how do you know? 

We know many people have mild symptoms.* How much COVID is circulating untested and unacknowledged?

 (*at first. We also know people who had mild symptoms can have organ damage that only becomes visible later)

Already I'm hearing from people like "my school has been mask optional for a while now and it's fine!"

Is it? 
How do you know?
